message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.IR. 

The paper is about improving the evaluation of natural language generation (NLG) systems through a novel rank-based magnitude estimation method. This falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of Bayesian estimation, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG). The focus on improving human ratings suggests a potential application in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of evaluating NLG systems according to multiple criteria, which could fall under information retrieval (cs.IR).
